definition: to count numbers/to keep to one's word/to hold (i.e. to remain valid)/to count (i.e. to be important)
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
frequently/repeatedly
number/figure/several/CL:個|个[ge4]
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
computational mathematics/numerical mathematics
to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
promises must be kept

sentences.english: I doubt that you have two brain cells to rub together-does that count?
sentences.chinese: 我懷疑你沒有兩個能融到一起的腦細胞，這算數麼？

sentences.english: We always mean what we say do what we promise.
sentences.chinese: 我們一貫是說話算數的。

sentences.english: The meeting times printed on our programs were largely theoretical.
sentences.chinese: 印在我們日程表上的會談時間基本上不算數。

sentences.english: Their number incalculable; Thus also is the assembly of Bodhisattvas.
sentences.chinese: 非是算數之所能知，諸菩薩衆，亦復如是。

sentences.english: You may trust him, he is as good as his word.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信他，他說話算數。

sentences.english: He certainly means what he said.
Saying" I love you" immediately before, during, or following sex doesn't count.
sentences.chinese: 性愛之前，之後，之中說“我愛你”不算數。

sentences.english: You should never go back on your word, if possible.
sentences.chinese: 如果可能，永遠不要說話不算數。

sentences.english: They couldn't come too fast forme. I have always remembered figures.
sentences.chinese: 這些算數難不住我，因爲我總能記住數字。

sentences.english: Your children should be literate and numerate.
sentences.chinese: 你的孩子應該會識字算數。

sentences.english: You promesed to pay me tomorrow, keep your promise!
sentences.chinese: 你說過明天付款的，你要說話算數。

sentences.english: Who can guarantee that he will keep his word?
Who says sending roses to yourself doesn't count?
sentences.chinese: 誰說給自己送花不算數？

sentences.english: Just remember that the answers on the answer sheet are the only answers that count.
sentences.chinese: 切記答題卡上的答案是唯一算數的。

sentences.english: I am a man of my word .
What happens if my computer suddenly loses power while I am in the middle of playing? Does my donation still count?
sentences.chinese: 如果在玩遊戲時電腦突然斷電，我的捐贈還算數嗎？

definition: lie/false words/nonsense/CL:篇[pian1]
a lie/untrue statement/misstatement
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
in a few words (idiom); expressed succinctly
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
plain/clear/obvious
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
nothing serious/just hot air
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to force someone to do something
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
